org.orgName: Third Judicial District Court of Washington Territory

div1.p:
In the matter of the application of Habeas Corpus for J.S. McGuire}
In the Dist Court at Seattle King Co. W.T. Order.

Now comes Jas H. Lewis attorney for the applicant J. S. McGuire who upon oath deposes and says that the said J. S. McGuire is restrained illegally of his liberty by J. H. McGraw Sheriff in and that he desires to sue out a suit of Habeas Corpus, that the said J. S. McGuire is a pauper, that he has no funds whereby to prosecute his said application, and most humbly prays that his honorable court to grant him an order allowing him the right to sue in forma prayer is in order to prosecute his writ of Habeas Corpus - Jas H Lewis atty for J. S. McGuire

sworn to before me this 5 June 1885
Harold Preston Notary Public

On reading the motion to see un forma pauperis of J. S. McGuire setting out by his attorney J. H. Lewis that he is restrained of his liberty, & desires to prosecute a writ of Habeas Corpus, and the Court being advised grants said motion and permits said petitioner to sue in pauper formatits forma pauperis. Greene J.

4446
FILED JUN 5 1885 James Seavey, Clerk By James P Ludlow Deputy Clerk.
